Title: ADDENDUM No. 1 RFP JA-207652 Student and Staff Computing Devices
Pre Bid Meeting: A pre-bid call took place where a Dallas ISD representative mentioned OEM warranty only.
Installation: Installation requirements include white glove services (asset decaling, asset reporting, etching on laptops, and delivery to varied locations). Desktops are not required to be secured. The awarded vendor will need to coordinate a schedule of deliveries with the Dallas ISD ED TECH department. Vendors are also asked to submit a minimum price for deployment services, with additional options provided as an attachment.

Bid Summary: Addendum No. 1 to RFP JA-207652 for Student and Staff Computing Devices. This addendum provides responses to vendors' questions, clarifies requirements for USB ports, award timeline (August board meeting), delivery schedule (quotes starting Sept 2024), funding (bond-funded), white glove services (etching only on Laptops, not monitors/AIOs), warranty (1-year for Chromebooks, 3-years for Windows laptops, OEM only, no ADP required), pricing submission details (minimum price in system, additional options as attachment), reference contact timeline (within a week of due date), no desktop securing, no vendor inventory requirement, no local location requirement, hot swap for warranty work longer than 5 business days, no onsite project manager requirement, no proximity for references, quantities spread over contract life, DISD has Microsoft Volume License Agreement, AIO Desktops require webcam, 'Bid Minimum Release Amount' field can be disregarded, manufacturer warranties required, both etching and asset tagging required, Form 1295 due with RFP response, electronic responses do not require PDF version with direct edits if space is insufficient (supporting documentation can be attached), Windows devices require autopilot, Chromebooks require Google Management enrollment, no monthly quantity estimates, battery life based on manufacturer specs, samples required from awarded vendors for large quantities, 65w chargers are minimum for Chrome, and DISD will not negotiate legal terms and conditions (deviations may lead to non-responsive submission). This addendum's information is incorporated into any awarded contract, and bidders must acknowledge and submit a copy with their proposal, while all other provisions and terms remain unchanged.
Product Specification: For Display monitors: USB 3.1 is a minimum requirement, USB 3.2 is permissible. Laser etching is not required. For Laptops: Etching is required. A one-year warranty is required for student Chromebooks, and a three-year warranty for student and staff Windows laptops. Warranties must be OEM. Accidental Damage Protection (ADP) is not required. Hot swap is required only when warranty work will be longer than 5 business days. For Windows devices, Autopilot is required. For Chromebooks, enrollment in Google Management is required. Battery life will be based on manufacturer's specifications. 65w chargers are a minimum requirement for Chrome devices. For AIO Computers: Laser etching is not required. A webcam is required. General requirements: All deliveries and deployments must incorporate white glove services, including asset decaling, asset reporting, etching, and delivery to varied locations. Both etching and asset tagging are required for devices. Desktops are not required to be secured.
